title: Fetal Biophysical Profile (BPP) Score
description: Predicts need for urgent delivery based on sonographic and non-stress test. Assesses for fetal distress in high-risk pregnancies.

labels.2: ≥1 episode of rhythmic breathing lasting ≥30 sec within 30 min
≥3 discrete body or limb movements within 30 min
≥1 episode of extremity extension and subsequent return to flexion
A pocket of amniotic fluid ≥2 cm in 2 perpendicular planes
≥2 accelerations of ≥15 beats/min for ≥15 sec within 20-40 min

ranges.interpretation: Almost certain fetal asphyxia. Immediate delivery indicated.
Probable fetal asphyxia. Repeat testing immediately. If persistent, delivery indicated.
Possible fetal asphyxia. If abnormal fluid, delivery indicated. If normal fluid, repeat test in 24 hours.
Normal, non-asphyxiated fetus. No intervention required. Repeat test per protocol.
Normal, non-asphyxiated fetus. No intervention required. Repeat test weekly.

references: Manning FA, Platt LD, Sipos L. Antepartum fetal evaluation: development of a fetal biophysical profile. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 1980 Mar 15;136(6):787-95.
Kim SY, Khandelwal M, Gaughan JP, Agar MH, Reece EA. Is the intrapartum biophysical profile useful? Obstet Gynecol. 2003 Sep;102(3):471-6.
formula: BPP Score = Fetal Breathing + Fetal Movement + Fetal Tone + Amniotic Fluid + NST (each parameter scores 0 or 2)
notes: Typically performed after 28-32 weeks of pregnancy
Score of 8/10 with normal fluid requires no intervention
Score of 8/10 with oligohydramnios may require delivery
May be repeated once or twice weekly in high-risk pregnancies
